Potato_Early_blight.symptom: Dark brown concentric spots on older leaves, leading to leaf drop and reduced yield
Potato_Early_blight.treatment: Use disease-free seed tubers, apply fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil, and practice crop rotation

Potato_healthy.symptom: Leaves are green and uniform without spots or discoloration

Potato_Late_blight.symptom: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems that turn brown and cause plant collapse
Potato_Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like metalaxyl or cymoxanil, remove infected plants, and ensure good field drainage

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptom: Small dark brown spots with yellow halos on leaves and fruit, leading to defoliation
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use copper-based bactericides, avoid overhead irrigation, and use certified seed

Tomato_Early_blight.symptom: Concentric dark brown rings on lower leaves, causing yellowing and drying
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides (mancozeb, chlorothalonil), remove infected debris, and use resistant varieties

Tomato_healthy.symptom: Leaves are green and turgid with no disease symptoms

Tomato_Late_blight.symptom: Irregular, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems with white mold growth under humid conditions
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Use resistant varieties, remove affected plants, and apply systemic fungicides

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptom: Yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces with olive-green mold growth underneath
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Ensure good ventilation, avoid excess humidity, and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper oxychloride

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptom: Small circular spots with dark borders and gray centers appearing on lower leaves
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves, improve air circulation, and use protective fungicides

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_m.symptom: Tiny yellow or white specks on leaves with fine webbing and eventual leaf drop
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray miticides or neem oil and maintain field humidity to reduce mite population

Tomato_Target_Spot.symptom: Brown circular lesions with concentric rings on leaves and fruit, causing premature leaf fall
Tomato_Target_Spot.treatment: Use crop rotation, apply fungicides like azoxystrobin or chlorothalonil, and avoid overcrowding

Tomato_Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptom: Mosaic light and dark green mottling on leaves, distortion, and stunted growth
Tomato_Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: No chemical cure; remove infected plants, disinfect tools, and use resistant varieties

Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptom: Upward curling and yellowing of leaves, stunted plants, and reduced fruit set
Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Control whitefly vectors, use virus-free seedlings, and plant resistant cultivars
